alert.note: Alert for Bernalillo; Sandoval; Torrance; Valencia (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued April 22 at 2:47PM MDT until April 22 at 4:45PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Valencia County in central New Mexico... Southeastern Sandoval County in north central New Mexico... Bernalillo County in central New Mexico... West central Torrance County in central New Mexico... * Until 445 PM MDT. * At 246 PM MDT, an area of dust was over the Albuquerque Metro Area, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Less than two miles visibility with strong wind in excess of 55 mph. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters and satellite imagery. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 133 and 173. Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 190 and 249. Highway 550 between Mile Markers 1 and 10. Locations impacted include... Albuquerque, Rio Rancho, Valencia, Los Lunas, Corrales, Bernalillo, Belen, Los Ranchos De Albuquerque, Bosque Farms and Peralta. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust creates reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
